title: Maven create app command is ignoring the version
body:
### Describe the bug

Base on the Doc if I run the following command
```
mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.7.6.Final:create \
    -DprojectGroupId=my-groupId \
    -DprojectArtifactId=my-artifactId
```

I should be  able to create an app pointing to Quarkus 2.7.6.Final but is pointing to the latest version.
So basically the issue is that I am not able to create a Quarkus app pointing to...2.7.6.Final


### Expected behavior

The following command should create a Quarkus app pointing to Quarkus 2.7.6.Final
```
mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.7.6.Final:create \
    -DprojectGroupId=my-groupId \
    -DprojectArtifactId=my-artifactId
```

### Actual behavior

The created app is always pointing to the latest version

### How to Reproduce?

```
mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.7.6.Final:create \
    -DprojectGroupId=my-groupId \
    -DprojectArtifactId=my-artifactId
```

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux fedora 6.0.11-200.fc36.x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk 17.0.5 2022-10-18 OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.4 (Red Hat 3.8.4-3)

### Additional information

_No response_
